member.name: F:NBidi.UnicodeGeneralCategory.Pi
member.summary: Punctuation, Initial quote (may behave like Ps or Pe depending on usage)

member.name: F:NBidi.UnicodeGeneralCategory.Pf
member.summary: Punctuation, Final quote (may behave like Ps or Pe depending on usage)

member.name: F:NBidi.UnicodeGeneralCategory.Cn
member.summary: Other, Not Assigned (no characters in the file have this property)

member.name: T:NBidi.BidiChars
member.summary: A set of common Unicode characters, including BiDi control characters, and some Arabic letters used mainly for testing purposes.

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiChars.ARABIC_ALEF_MADDA_ABOVE
member.summary: Arabic Letter Alef With Madda Above

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiChars.ARABIC_ALEF_HAMZA_ABOVE
member.summary: Arabic Letter Alef With Hamza Above

member.summary: Arabic Letter Alef With Hamza Below

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiChars.ARABIC_LAM_ALEF_MADDA_ABOVE_ISOLATED
member.summary: Arabic Ligature Lam With Alef With Madda Above Isolated Form

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiChars.ARABIC_LAM_ALEF_MADDA_ABOVE_FINAL
member.summary: Arabic Ligature Lam With Alef With Madda Above Final Form

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiChars.ARABIC_LAM_ALEF_HAMZA_ABOVE_ISOLATED
member.summary: Arabic Ligature Lam With Alef With Hamza Above Isolated Form

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiChars.ARABIC_LAM_ALEF_HAMZA_ABOVE_FINAL
member.summary: Arabic Ligature Lam With Alef With Hamza Above Final Form

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiChars.ARABIC_LAM_ALEF_HAMZA_BELOW_ISOLATED
member.summary: Arabic Ligature Lam With Alef With Hamza Below Isolated Form

member.summary: Arabic Ligature Lam With Alef Final Form

member.name: T:NBidi.DirectionalOverrideStatus
member.summary: Directional Override Statii used to determine current letter direction (Table 2 in the Unicode BiDi algorithm).

member.name: F:NBidi.DirectionalOverrideStatus.RTL
member.summary: Characters are to be reset to R.

member.name: F:NBidi.DirectionalOverrideStatus.LTR
member.summary: Characters are to be reset to L.

member.name: T:NBidi.ArabicShapeJoiningType
member.summary: Letter joining types of Arabic letters.

member.name: T:NBidi.UnicodeDecompositionType
member.summary: The type of Unicode character decomposition.

member.name: F:NBidi.UnicodeDecompositionType.None
member.summary: A base form or no special variant.

member.name: F:NBidi.UnicodeDecompositionType.Font
member.summary: A font variant (e.g. a blackletter form).

member.name: F:NBidi.UnicodeDecompositionType.NoBreak
member.summary: A no-break version of a space or hyphen.

member.name: T:NBidi.LetterForm
member.summary: The four different available letter presentation forms.

member.name: F:NBidi.LetterForm.Initial
member.summary: A presentation form of a letter that begins a sequence of connected letters.

member.name: F:NBidi.LetterForm.Medial
member.summary: A presentation form of a letter that is connected to other letters on both sides.

member.name: F:NBidi.LetterForm.Final
member.summary: A presentation form of a letter that ends a sequence of connected letters.

member.name: F:NBidi.LetterForm.Isolated
member.summary: A presentation form of a letter that is not connected to other letters on either sides.

member.name: M:NBidi.UnicodeCharacterDataResolver.GetBidiCharacterType(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns the BiDi type for a given character.
member.param: A Unicode character for which to get the BiDi type.

member.name: M:NBidi.UnicodeCharacterDataResolver.GetUnicodeGeneralCategory(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns the Unicode category for a given character.
member.param: A Unicode character for which to get the general Unicode category.

member.name: M:NBidi.UnicodeCharacterDataResolver.GetUnicodeCanonicalClass(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns the Unicode canonical class for a given character.
member.param: A Unicode character for which to get the Unicode canonical class.

member.name: T:NBidi.BidiCharacterType
member.summary: Types of BiDi characters (Table 4 in the Unicode BiDi algorithm).

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.L
member.example: LRM, most alphabetic, syllabic, Han ideographs, non-European or non-Arabic digits, ...

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.R
member.example: RLM, Hebrew alphabet, and related punctuation

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.AL
member.example: Arabic, Thaana, and Syriac alphabets, most punctuation specific to those scripts, ...

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.AN
member.example: Arabic-Indic digits, Arabic decimal and thousands separators, ...

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.CS
member.example: Colon, comma, full stop (period), No-break space, ...

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.NSM
member.example: Characters marked Mn (Nonspacing_Mark) and Me (Enclosing_Mark) in the Unicode Character Database

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.BN
member.example: Most formatting and control characters, other than those explicitly given types above

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.B
member.example: Paragraph separator, appropriate Newline Functions, higher-level protocol paragraph determination

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.WS
member.example: Space, figure space, line separator, form feed, General Punctuation spaces, ...

member.name: F:NBidi.BidiCharacterType.ON
member.example: All other characters, including OBJECT REPLACEMENT CHARACTER

member.name: T:NBidi.UnicodeCanonicalClass
member.summary: The different canonical classes of Unicode characters.

member.name: F:NBidi.UnicodeCanonicalClass.NR
member.remarks: Spacing, split, enclosing, reordrant, and Tibetan subjoined.

member.name: T:NBidi.BidiCharacterMirrorResolver
member.summary: An helper class that provides the mirrored alternatives for characters.

member.name: M:NBidi.BidiCharacterMirrorResolver.GetBidiCharacterMirror(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns the corresponding mirrored character for the given character, if any. If no mirroring available, returns the given character.
member.returns: The mirrored character, or the given character if no mirroring available.

member.name: T:NBidi.NBidi
member.summary: The main class that implements the BIDI algorithm.
member.remarks: Note that the BiDi algorithm does not cover reordering a visual string to logical form. Some times the very same algorithm will do the job, but in more complex situations it'll fail. The correct way is to always work in logical form in memory, and only run the BiDi algorithm to display the results on the screen.

member.name: M:NBidi.NBidi.LogicalToVisual(System.String)
member.summary: Implementation of the BIDI algorithm, as described in http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr9/tr9-17.html
member.returns: The visual representation of the string.

member.name: M:NBidi.NBidi.LogicalToVisual(System.String,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Implementation of the BIDI algorithm, as described in http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr9/tr9-17.html
member.param: Implies where the original characters are.
Implies how many characters each original character occupies.
member.returns: The visual representation of the string.

member.name: M:NBidi.NBidi.Paragraph.FixMirroredCharacters
member.summary: L4. A character is depicted by a mirrored glyph if and only if (a) the resolved directionality of that character is R, and (b) the Bidi_Mirrored property value of that character is true.

member.name: M:NBidi.NBidi.Paragraph.PerformArabicShaping(System.String)
member.summary: 3.5 Shaping Implements rules R1-R7 and rules L1-L3 of section 8.2 (Arabic) of the Unicode standard.

member.name: M:NBidi.NBidi.Paragraph.TypeForLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the strong type (L or R) corresponding to the embedding level.

member.name: M:NBidi.NBidi.Paragraph.FindRunLimit(System.Int32,System.Int32,NBidi.BidiCharacterType[])
member.summary: Return the limit of the run, starting at index, that includes only resultTypes in validSet. This checks the value at index, and will return index if that value is not in validSet.

member.name: M:NBidi.NBidi.Paragraph.SetTypes(System.Int32,System.Int32,NBidi.BidiCharacterType)
member.summary: Set resultTypes from start up to (but not including) limit to newType.
